## Pull request overview This PR successfully extracts the core OCR redaction logic from browser-specific code and implements a comprehensive CLI tool, achieving platform independence through an adapter pattern. **Key Changes:** - Extracted core processing logic to `src/core/` with platform-agnostic interfaces - Implemented adapter pattern for browser (HTMLCanvas) and Node.js (node-canvas) environments - Added full-featured CLI with commander.js supporting all detection settings and custom rules ### Reviewed changes Copilot reviewed 11 out of 12 changed files in this pull request and generated 10 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | `src/core/processor.ts` | Core image processing and OCR logic, now platform-independent using adapter interfaces | | `src/core/matcher.ts` | Pattern matching utilities extracted for reusability across platforms | | `src/core/image-processing.ts` | Image preprocessing logic (grayscale, contrast enhancement) decoupled from DOM | | `src/core/interfaces.ts` | Platform-agnostic interfaces defining canvas and image abstractions | | `src/adapters/BrowserCanvasAdapter.ts` | Browser implementation using HTMLCanvasElement and Image API | | `src/adapters/NodeCanvasAdapter.ts` | Node.js implementation using node-canvas library | | `src/cli.ts` | New CLI entry point with comprehensive command-line options and error handling | | `src/utils/ocr.ts` | Refactored to wrap core processor with backward compatibility exports | | `src/utils/canvas.ts` | Simplified to re-export preprocessing function from core | | `package.json` | Added CLI dependencies (canvas, chalk, commander, tsx) and CLI script | | `package-lock.json` | Updated lockfile with new dependencies and version bumps | | `README.md` | Added CLI usage documentation and updated project structure |
